result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
Defendant has two open cases.  Cash bail on this case is to be held pending any restitution/costs ordered in the open cases.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared on behalf of Laura Crivello for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in this case with the following cases:  15CF874, 15CF162 and 15CF977.  Court granted State's motion and ordered this case dismissed but read in.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has two other pending cases; parties request another plea date to resolve all cases before Branch 20 as part of a global resolution.  This court granted that request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Discharge Summary report from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant in custody on new case 15CF977.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 This case was improperly tabbed.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Stipulation and Order to Withdraw as Attorney.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Upon oral motion of the State, Court amends complaint to refelct the date of January "18" 2015 on pages 1 and 3. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Department Detective Thomas Carr. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 7.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretiral Report dated 3/5/15.
HMP

15RM010546  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/28/15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ERIC B., AND CO-DEF'S:  WALTER COLEMAN AND MONTRELL HILSON.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
